summary_of_threads_started_this_week:
The Bitcoin Core development community has announced version v30.2, introducing several enhancements, bug fixes, and compatibility updates, facilitating a smoother upgrade process for users across various systems. This release underscores the project's commitment to security, performance, and backward compatibility, with acknowledgment to contributors such as Ava Chow, brunoerg, fanquake, and others for their significant roles. The upgrade guidance and compatibility details are elaborately provided to ensure users transition efficiently from older versions, highlighting the importance of updating to leverage the improvements ([Bitcoin Core's website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-30.2/)).

Discussions within the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, led by Matt, have brought to light challenges related to `minrelaytxfee` and `incrementalrelayfee` settings, prompting a proposal to amend the `feefilter` message to enhance transaction relaying policies. This initiative aims to increase transparency, reduce spam, and facilitate smoother peer connections by allowing nodes to communicate their Replace-By-Fee (RBF) policies more effectively, demonstrating a proactive approach to addressing operational inefficiencies in Bitcoin's network ([Bitcoin Development Mailing List](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/a02be21c-2483-4753-b6db-4bd159e8c4e0n@googlegroups.com/T/#m37debc8393e229593ce3775c3548bc2798eb48a9)).

In addition to core updates, the community is exploring innovations in smart contract language with **Bithoven**, which aims to marry the structured correctness of Miniscript with an imperative control flow syntax for safer and more intuitive Bitcoin Script development. This development, alongside the introduction of Hornet UTXO(1) as part of the Hornet Node project, represents significant strides towards optimizing Bitcoin consensus validation and client technology, highlighting ongoing efforts to improve efficiency, safety, and usability within the ecosystem ([Bithoven development](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bithoven-a-formally-verified-imperative-smart-contract-language-for-bitcoin/2189), [Hornet UTXO(1) project](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/hornet-utxo-1-a-custom-constant-time-highly-parallel-utxo-database/2201)).

new_threads_this_week.title: Bitcoin Core v30.2rc1 Released
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v30.2rc1 introduces new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements.
- Upgrade requires shutting down old software, supporting direct upgrades from EOL versions.
- It ensures compatibility with Linux Kernel 3.17+, macOS 13+, and Windows 10 or later.

new_threads_this_week.title: BIP Idea: incrementalrelayfee in feefilter?
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Matt addresses issues with Bitcoin's `minrelaytxfee` and `incrementalrelayfee` settings in Core 30.0.
- He proposes adding `incrementalrelayfee` to `feefilter` to improve transparency and policy compatibility.
- The change aims to reduce spam, enhance user connectivity, and poses no consensus risks.

new_threads_this_week.title: Wallet Migration Failure May Delete Unrelated Wallet Files In Bitcoin Core 30.0 and 30.1
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- A bug in Bitcoin Core versions 30.0 and 30.1 could delete wallet files, causing fund loss.
- Users are advised against wallet migrations until version 30.2 is released to fix the issue.
- The problem mainly affects attempts to migrate or load default wallet.dat files.

new_threads_this_week.title: Follow-up regarding Motion to Activate BIP 3
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The Bitcoin community strongly supports adopting BIP 3, with influential figures endorsing it.
- Concerns over the LLM-policy within BIP 3 were reversed after community feedback.
- Melvin Carvalho highlighted a need for broader consensus on BIP 3's activation.

new_threads_this_week.title: Bitcoin Core v30.2 Released
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v30.2 is now officially available, featuring new updates and bug fixes.
- Users are advised to fully shut down older versions before upgrading to v30.2.
- Compatibility extends to newer versions of Linux, macOS, and Windows, with explicit tests conducted.

new_threads_this_week.title: Bithoven: A Formally Verified, Imperative Smart Contract Language for Bitcoin
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Bithoven introduces a smart contract language combining Miniscript's correctness with C-like syntax.
- It ensures safety and efficiency in Bitcoin Script through `LR(1)` parsing and static analysis.
- Community engagement is encouraged via resources like GitHub, a Web IDE, and formal documentation.

new_threads_this_week.title: Incremental mutation testing in the Bitcoin Core
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Mutation testing in Bitcoin Core involves weekly checks to evaluate test suite effectiveness.
- Incremental mutation testing reduces time and resource needs by focusing on recent code changes.
- Effective mutation testing requires refining fuzz targets and identifying relevant mutations for better bug detection.

new_threads_this_week.title: Hornet UTXO(1): A custom, constant-time, highly parallel UTXO database
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Hornet UTXO(1) enhances Bitcoin client technology with its high performance and concurrency.
- It revalidated the Bitcoin mainnet chain greatly faster than Bitcoin Core on similar hardware.
- This project, presented in T. Sharp's paper, seeks community input and support for further development.

active_posts_this_week.title: Addressing remaining points on BIP 54
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Provoost explores using the nLocktime field for extranonce in coinbase transactions for mining efficiency.
- BIP54's role is debated concerning miner advantages versus energy consumption with alternative data storing methods suggested.
- He advocates for segregating consensus changes, emphasizing coordination for development despite increased effort.

active_posts_this_week.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- A cap of six sigops for Bitcoin's `CHECKMULTISIG(VERIFY)` is proposed to facilitate caching.
- The change adds complexity and mainly impacts users of large legacy multisignature transactions.
- Feedback is sought on the modification, highlighting a consultative decision-making approach.

active_posts_this_week.title: A simple backup scheme for wallet accounts
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The discussion proposes switching the default encryption from AES-GCM to CHACHA20.
- It emphasizes a seamless integration into the core, avoiding new dependencies.
- This change aims to improve security without adding external libraries.

active_posts_this_week.title: OP_CC: A simple introspection opcode to enable cheaper consolidations
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The concept of incentivizing address reuse financially is considered unfeasible.
- Skepticism is evident regarding the adoption of this policy among stakeholders.
- Concerns are raised about the practicality and effectiveness of encouraging address reuse.

active_posts_this_week.title: What is the importance of running a node?
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The discussion points out the high bandwidth costs in blockchain operations.
- It highlights the strain on nodes from many users depending on one for access.
- Suggests sustainable management of bandwidth is crucial for blockchain equity and functionality.

active_posts_this_week.title: Ark as a Channel Factory: Compressed Liquidity Management for Improved Payment Feasibility
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Integration of Ark Server with LSP could greatly benefit mobile users.
- Technical challenges like LN-symmetry and rebindable signatures are being explored.
- Issues with processing forfeits remain unresolved despite the optimistic progress.

active_posts_this_week.title: Major BIP 360 Update
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The significance of terminology in quantum-resistant cryptographic systems is emphasized.
- "Hash" plays a crucial role due to its association with security and quantum resistance.
- Precise language is necessary to communicate the complexities of quantum-resistant cryptography.

active_posts_this_week.title: Propagation Delay and Mining Centralization: Modeling Stale Rates
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The blog updates on miner revenue changes linked to Bitcoin block times.
- A new analysis method highlights revenue impact, enhancing understanding of mining competitiveness.
- Code changes for this analysis are shared on GitHub, promoting open collaboration.

active_posts_this_week.title: A quantum resistance script only using op_ctv/op_txhash and no new signatures
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The proposal opts for a non-NUMS based mechanism, enhancing system resilience.
- It limits potential damage by reverting to the system's original construction for safety.
- This approach primarily prevents resource depletion by focusing on robust baseline defense.

active_posts_this_week.title: Writing version 2 of my Bitcoin Game Theory book with de Gruyter, what should I cover?
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- BIP 300 and 301 aim to introduce sidechains for Bitcoin, enhancing flexibility and innovation.
- Sidechains allow for new features and safe experimentation without compromising Bitcoin's main network.
- The CUSF concept enables Bitcoin network upgrades while keeping the core protocol untouched.

active_posts_this_week.title: Provable Cryptography for Bitcoin: An Introduction (Workbook)
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The email highlights [Joy of Cryptography](https://joyofcryptography.com/) as a valuable cryptographic resource.
- It offers insights beyond the Bitcoin realm, beneficial for broad cryptography knowledge.
- This website is suggested as a useful tool for those expanding their cryptographic understanding.
